column4: ok, i just ran a ntpupdate and now my clock time says its 6 hours ahead and now when i run sudo it says the timestamp is too far in the future
i'm not in gnome or kde, thats rather difficult
yes, how do you do it via command line
then i just missed the part about setting a time zone
it says timezoneconf is not installed and no info is available
ok here it is... in the file /etc/default/rcS toggle UTC=yes
now i just need to run the ntpupdate again right
i dont know that command. If it reinits your system clock then it should work... otherwise a reboot will do
